Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel! Shame its about to be demolished!”
Reviews.Author: kathy2909
Reviews.Content: We have just had a lovely stay at this hotel, the pool was fab as were the staff and facilities. The shops in the arcade were mostly shut but this is due to the demolision that's about to take place to make way for a new luxury high rise! This I feel is a shame, but its got to move with the times! The location for the malls and business area is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter3114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near a very busy road, but on the Metro station route. The outside bars and surrounding gardens are good. But as it is an old hotel, it is showing its age and is going to be completely rebuilt soon. The executive rooms are ok, but there is no ventilation. The choice of breakfast buffet items is quite limited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: a m
Reviews.Content: Was a last minute booking and the only hotel left in dubai with 3 double rooms. The hotel staff were very pleasant and welcoming. the only issue was the pool...it wasnt in the hotel...you had to walk to the leisure club in the next building. If your going to dubai then the hotel has to have to a swimming pool big enough to accommodate all the guest which was not the case here. Apart from that our stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed, but maybe not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: navyblu
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan was a pleasant place to stay when I desired to be "off the grid" of the central attractions of Dubai for relaxation. It is a little self-contained island that isn't in either the business or dining areas of the city, but it is an easy commute to more interesting locations. In Dubai, this isn't an issue as taxis are quite cheap. It is close to the Mall of the Emirates. I enjoyed the hotel pool and pool bar and usually had the place to myself during the mornings. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was comp. There is an English Pub, spa (which I enjoyed), restaurants, pool, and internet via cat5 cable only in the room. A generous, deep, full-sized bath tub (nice!). Clean comfortable room. This is an older hotel and the hallways seemed a bit dank and dreary but the room was quite nice. Two caveats: First, some rooms face the local light rail line and are noisy. Second, The Rattlesnake Club is a straight up brothel. You will certainly see Eastern European hookers passing through the hotel lobby, elevators and hallways with their gentleman companions in the evenings. But the Red Lion Pub was quite nice, and for the seasoned traveler the pluses outweighed the minuses. I might stay there again if traveling on business or solo, but never with a spouse or family. It is a pretty good value in an expensive city. Also, this is a popular hotel with US military on leave in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location and good value”
Reviews.Author: trickysam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year and found the rooms comfortable and clean. We found the service good even though the hotel was pretty busy over New Year. We didn't have any problems with noise and Housekeeping and was super quick. We were traveling with young children and you can fit one child in the fold out sofa but be warned, it takes up a lot of space in the room and isn't quite big enough for 2 children. The hotel has been around since the 70s so not as modern as other hotels but that's actually quite refreshing after a while in Dubai where everything is the biggest / newest / tallest/ shiniest. And the Burj Khalfa and Dubai Mall are just down the road. The Italian and Indian restaurants in the hotel both served good food. The Rattle Snake is well known in Dubai but that seedier side of the hotel is separate enough not to bother most guests too much. Happy Hour at the Red Lion (Dubai's oldest pub) was a favourite with my husband and Dad. The pool is not in the main hotel area but at the residence next and we didn't actually find it until the last day of our trip, which was a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Nomad422
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metropolitan for one night only. The room was clean as was the bathroom. As other reviewers have noted, the decor is a bit dated. The superior room was a reasonable size, with a sofa and a table. Bed was comfortable. The room location was disappointing - it was on the ground floor and faced an alleyway, so preferred to keep the curtains closed. Also at night time, some people would walk past talking loudly. Location next to Sheik Zayed highway is a positive, but the road designs meant that you sometimes had to travel a distance in order to go in the opposite direction. Parking options are valet parking or paid street parking. Internet was charged for, so didn't bother with it.

Reviews.Title: “verry bad service. noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: RamziM
Reviews.Content: unfriendly staff. noisy rooms, internet terriblly expensive. decore/rooms needs up-lift

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: nice_tie
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying in this hotel for two nights on a short trip to Dubai.  The hotel and room were fine but getting a little old compared to the shiny newness off most of the city.  The hotel is in a good central location   . Only a few mins from Dubai Mall or 10-15 mins from the palm or creek. This hotel is fine if you're just looking for a bed and will be out sightseeing all day. If you want a hotel where you can spend sometime and relax I'd look elsewhere. It's not like Dubai is short of options!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: tkfirefly
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, friendly staff. As you will see with other reviews, it is a bit older. That said, everything is in very good condition. Nice pool area. Just make sure to haggle prices for the tours & whatnot, as we learned to late that no prices are set in stone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fredericus71
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with outstanding attention to the customer. The hotel is very well located on Sheik Zayed Road, in between the Emirates Mall and the Mall of Dubai. Staff at the front desk make things easy and they prove to be very helpful and very curteous. I will definitly go back to this hotel just for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roylawro
Reviews.Content: A great location for a short stay in dubai, the hotel is excellent and the services first class. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. The indian restaurant was first class and the best in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: maryb8355
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Metropolitan many times before (we stay there every spring for the softball tournament). I have heard other people complain about their rooms, service, etc., etc. but up until this time had not experienced anything but average service. This time, however, it was a completely different story! At check in I asked to have things from my mini bar removed so they would not put a hold on my credit card and I do not use that stuff anyways. They refused and said they HAD to charge my credit card. Then they come to your room at least 4 times per day checking the mini bar and the expiration dates of the things in there. I am not exagerrating! The first night I went to Don Corleone's Restaurant and brought the food back to my room to eat. By the way, the food there is excellent! I could not finish all of it so I left it sitting on the table for the maid to throw away the next morning. Also on the table was a newspaper that I had read so it was all taken apart and spread out on the table underneath the pizza box. When I left for the morning they came to clean the room (or so I thought)! They did make the bed! They left all the trash, did not replenish the coffee or creamer that I used that morning, did not leave toilet paper, left only one towel, folded up the used washcloth (I had used it to mop up some water that was on the counter) and put it back in the tray, and did not empty any trash can in the room. When I came back to the room I saw that this was not done so I figured they would come back later to finish and I left for the afternoon. When I returned to the hotel I had to use the internet so I went to the internet cafe. I told them I would only need to use it for a few minutes and they replied that I would still have to pay for the full hour (the minimum they sold was an hour) so I told them that would be fine. It was only 15 AED so I thought I might check my email later, so what the heck! I literally was on the internet for 2 minutes and when I went to get the password so I might be able to log on later they told me that you have to use the time continuously and you were not allowed to log out and come back. When I went to the front desk they told me that was the policy and deal with it! There was an American gentleman standing behind me that also could not believe this was their policy and he told me he was going to purchase time but was not now because of what he just heard. Then I returned to my room to find everything as it was when I left earlier that morning. I was mad so I called the front desk and they said they did not handle such things to call Housekeeping. I will have to say the young man that came to fix things was very nice and apologetic. He left plenty of everything! Later that evening I went to the Red Lion Pub to eat and get a beer. I walked in and sat down without so much as any waitstaff acknowledging me. I sat at the table maybe 20 minutes before I asked to see a menu and get something to drink! It seemed that they were put out to have to wait on me or anyone that was there. The service was minimal and horrible! The food was good. The remainder of my trip (I left the next morning) was uneventful. The hotel room is okay - needs updating. Plenty of hot water for showers. Close to Dubai Mall if you want to go shopping. I will probably stay there if we go back to the softball tournament but never for anything else. There are to many other hotels there that care about their guests and theie quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “New Years”
Reviews.Author: Shooter38
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at the metroplitan hotel dubai for new years. They deorated the place very nicely in a holiday motive. The rooms were decent, i was upgraded to the premier or club rooms free of charge. Had a room overlooking the garden area. The Red Lion Pub was nice, I had a serlion steak that was a bit too chewey though. They have redone the garden area, which i believe will help keep down on the amount of ladies that visit. Overall, nice place, decent price. Wouldnt recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average because there's no rating between Poor and Average”
Reviews.Author: ServiceHawk
Reviews.Content: It's just not doin it. It's an 'ok' place, but really needs staff training. Some folks make allowances for the staff if the hotel is just awesome! Some folks make allowances for the hotel is awesome! This place isn't awesome. It's holding on by a VERY wide diversity of restaurants and bars, which is nice. Prices are more than reasonable. There's no complaint on the money end- you get what you pay for. But there are some things that just need tweaking with the staff. For example, pulling up to the hotel in a cab, there were 4 attendants, dressed in white, gathered around a podium next to the front sliding glass doors. None approached the vehicle. I waited. I watched them. I waited. The cab driver lowered the passenger side front and rear window and one of the men in white approached. He asked if I needed help. I asked him if he was planning on opening the door for me. He opened the door. You just shouldn't have to ask. They were busy talking and missed an opportunity to represent the hotel. Getting the room was fine, however, I use a service that monitors my cards and accounts and within an hour of checking in, I was alerted my card and email were compromised. This obviously is VERY concerning. Housekeeping came daily as they do, only this housekeeper took the last cold bottled drink I had in a bucket of watery ice- placed it on the table she had just cleaned, and took the ice away. ?? Nuts. The room was intruded every day by a hotel employee wanting to inspect the mini-bar. There has to be a better way to get that done. If the guest is in the room- leave the mini-bar 'till later maybe. Or, let guests know if they desire a mini-bar refill to contact guest services. What's more, after completing his inventory, he picked up the phone and called someone to report. This is totally unacceptable. You simply don't take liberties of any kind like that. It's just presumptuous on the part of the hotel employee to utilize any piece of equipment in the room. Come on in, turn on the TV, hang out! I'd offer you a cold drink, but the housekeeper took my ice! The steak fillet from the in-room dining menu was unusually good. I was not expecting it. I am spoiled and want prime beef. It may not have been prime, but it was properly prepared and had fantastic flavor. Served plain with a side of some very bland mushroom sauce which did not bother me as I do not put sauce on steak. Unfortunately, however, NO STEAK KNIFE! It's the details that will make or break a place, and they need to work on the details. Beds were hard, but then.. all the beds in Dubai are.

Reviews.Title: “Brothel”
Reviews.Author: Motorsport315
Reviews.Content: Too many "business ladies" at night. Not a place for a family to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: AbdulmohsiN
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities is very good especially Sky Garden (only in good weather from Oct till March), unfortunately rooms need renovation, the Metro (Business Bay) is little far away about 5 min walking.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KaliThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: It is a 4-star hotel, which has lost its glamour of the '80s. It is not very clean (hair in the bathtub, stains under the WC) and the air-conditioning gives a strange smell in the rooms. Moreover, there is a bar on the ground floor where beautiful girls "offer" their company to men, and follow them to their rooms. Finally, everytime we wanted to take a taxi, the hotel personnel offered us a pirate taxi, without taximeter, whereas there were normal taxis waiting in front of the hotel. I do not have the best impression of the hotel. However, everybody in the hotel was kind and helpful and the barman in the pianobar on the ground floor was really helpful and good.

Reviews.Title: “Cat House”
Reviews.Author: Oldstyle_53
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan 2 weeks per month for over a year. I was excited when the garden eating area was renovated and was told that the 'girls' were not going to be allowed on the grounds anymore. It got MUCH worse. They now are bold enough to approach customers at the outdoor restaurant tables. There are fights and banging doors every night at 4:00am when the "Cloobs" close. The police are there often. Makes you wonder what kind of bed you're sleeping in. Won't mention what I found under the bed. Really sorry I had to find a new hotel. They have a fantastic friendly staff, decent restaurants and good location. They just have to make up their mind if they want to be a hotel or a house of ill repute.

Reviews.Title: “Average but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Sstamina
Reviews.Content: There are enough comments here on the overall state of the hotel which i cannot disagree with - rather average, can get better for same price etc. I will put my view in two lists of nice and so much things that I remembered: Nice - the pool was never full and i could always enjoy some quite time without too much noise. - the spa and massage and a Morrocan bath I got it all in a package 250AED ($70) and it was great and very relaxing. - Foot massage was excellent too, 45 min of relaxation, you pay AED80 ($20) and get two sessions of two massage. You can share it with someone, I could not get my partner to try it so gave it away and do not regret it :) - There is a cinema connected to the hotel so there is something to do at night if it's boring. - The hotel provides you with a Dubai something magazine that tells you what's happenig in the Dunai in the nearest week, where all the special deal, happy hours and etc are, use it. Apparently we went to Trader Vic's a day after their 3days long deal on free ladies coctails was over. Just because we hadn't looked in the magazine. - Our towels were always clean, the room was quite clean too. - Most of staff is very nice and friendly, a couple of times we had to wait 10-15 min just to ask a question or sign something because there was only 1 person at the reception desk but it's not a big deal (only when you are rushing to jump into the nice cool water in the pool) Not so nice - Internet is sooo expensive, it's a rip off! Almost $9 per hour it's not even funny. - Beach is tooo far away, even though they give you a shuttle ( I think it leaves at 9 and then picks you up from the beach at 3.15) it is such a long journey, and if you can not wait for the shuttle or missed it or want to leave earlier - it cost us a lot of money just to get a taxi back (i think about $25). - Breakfast gets quite boring after a few days, selection isn't great but it's ok, we made the most of it. - The room wasn't big, we had to move the sofa to be able to properly open the suitcase. That's all I can think of so far, remember to make the most of your holidays and not get upset with little things like that, but I wouldn't go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: JuliaHild
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 8 nights in the beginning of NOV 2011. The hotel is old and needs renovation. Reception staff differs greatly from very unfriendly to somewhat helpful. Upon arrival I was given a room of a questionable quality, on the first floor, overlooking the breakfast area, the guy at the egg station was looking straight in the room window from his place, so I had to keep the blinders closed at all times. The receptionist refused to change the room saying that they were overbooked. I managed to change my room only next day with the help of guest relation stuff, who were great and helpful! Bed linen - very old, darned. When I arrived the room was cleaned but the linen was left dirty Cleanliness of the room - 6 points out of 10. They never wiped out dust. Towels - they often forget to put towels after cleaning the room, so I always had to ask for them, nearly everyday. Restaurants – Fish restaurant and Chinese restaurants are closed. Italian is good. Never saw anyone at the Indian one. IMHO it is a 3 star hotel, no more than that. You can find much better hotel in Dubai for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Clean Hotel, Not Overly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: clovebs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan for two nights in mid-November. The hotel looked nice enough, but was definitely not one of the more modern/newer hotels in Dubai. Lobby was very well appointed and the staff was exceptionally friendly and courtesy. We arrived several hours before check-in and the staff was very helpful about getting our rooms made up; the concierge held our bags while we we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast and waited. Albeit clean, the room was rather small with barely enough room to walk around. Beds were very firm, as were the pillows. The couch was comfy and the flat-screen TV was nice. The room also had a controllable thermostat. Internet was 30 AED for 1hr or 100 AED for 24hrs. It was also VERY slow! I was told that the wireless in the lobby was faster. (Rooms were wired, cable included) Breakfast was included with our room. They had a good spread - breads, cereals, fruits, some western dishes and some middle eastern dishes, as well as a egg bar (cooked to order). When we checked in, we were offered the "executive package" - this was 200 AED (300 for a double) per night and offered daily breakfast, all-day internet access, daily newspaper, complimentary airport transportation, and a 6pm late check-out. We opted out since all we really wanted/needed was the internet and we could get that for 100 AED. The hotel offers a free shuttle rides to the Mall of Dubai and the Mall of the Emirates. Shuttle ran on time (except when we had him wait for a few minutes so our travel mate could finish a phone call). Check with the concierge for times. The hotel is next to a cinema; we didn't have any interest with it so we didn't check it out. There are also a few restaurants in or near the hotel. Standard flare and decent prices. But, with so many things to do and see in Dubai, be sure to venture out from the hotel and explore other eateries. Other reviews have commented about the adjacent Rattlesnake and the 'women'. While I did not visit the Rattlesnake, a few of my mates did. They enjoyed the club and had a good time. However, we did not see any 'women' in the hotel lobby - they seemed to stay in the club. I wouldn't let previous reviews affect your decision too much about whether or not to stay here. While the hotel is older, it is centrally located in Dubai - malls and several things to do and see in either direction. However, with the exception of the cinema, the Rattlesnake, and the few restaurants, there is not much else close by. Use the free shuttle service or take a taxi. In closing, this was a nice hotel but I will probably not stay here again. While I enjoyed my stay, I think there are far too many other hotels in Dubai - don't get bore-sighted on this one which comes off as rather standard.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not more”
Reviews.Author: SwissKnife
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Metropolitan hotel for a stop over on my way back from India to Switzerland. I wanted to enjoy the warm weather and the beach in Dubai. As I could not afford a beach hotel, I've chosen Metropolitan, because it offers a shuttle service to their partner hotel at the beach. Entrance is about €25, which is ok. The rooms in Metropolitan would need some renovation, but everything was clean. The beer garden is very nice, as you can sit outside and enjoy the warmth of Dubai. I also liked the large swimming pool. The hotel is a bit isolated, but taxis are not very expensive or you can take the metro (10 minutes walking to station).

Reviews.Title: “Old school classic but with modern twist”
Reviews.Author: londonhaks
Reviews.Content: Metropolitan hotel - Dubai I spent 4 nights at this hotel in october 2011. We got discounted prepaid rates through booking.com. the hotel is what I would rate as a basic four star, staying in the delux double room was adequate - it didn't have a view or anything but that didn't bother me. The beds were extremely comfortable even with the aircon set to the lowest level it provided a nice gentle coolness that was welcomed during the humid October Dubai nights. The reception staff were friendly and helpful as were the concierge - however they lacked some local knowledge. There are a few bars - the popular one seemed to be the revamped sky garden with it's own shisha hut - the concierge didn't know the shisha hut was there ... I hired a car for the stay And driving was easy and with free parking at the hotel it came handy. Dubai is fairly expensive so be prepared to spend - the only thing that is cheap is fuel and parking. They operate a pay and display system which costs 2aed per hour - its free from 09.00 pm till approx 0800am an then between 13.00 and 16.00. The metropolitAn is conveniently located on shiek zYed road - but be under no impression that sheik zayed is a normal road - it's a 8 lane monstrosity but allows you to get through different parts of Dubai quickly. The burj khalifah and dubai mall are only few min away by car. Past that you have old Dubai and the souqs which are worth a visit - its something different and provides a more organic feel. In the opposite direction you have mall of the emirates with the ski Dubai centre, jumeira beach, Atlantis palm and Dubai marinA. The hotel does day passes to the habtoor grand palace resort and spa for 120 aed. This gives you access to the hotel pool, private beach and is worth it if you want to be able to enjoy the beach. Otherwise the public beach is available in a few locations though I checked it out near the jumeira beach hotel.  Food wise I only had some of the snacks from the sky garden bar which were all delicious and value for money. The Swedish band playing popular covers were great. We just had one negative e experience with a waitress at the sky garden who for some reason claimed that the tables near the band were for groups of four or more yet there plenty of pairs and singles sitting there already - after causing bit of a commotion we were allowed to sit where we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept standard 4* hotel from first hotel boom.”
Reviews.Author: KeithMander
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan hotel is located along the main Sheikh Zayed Road that spans the southern side of the city. It's positioned between two metro stations, with Business Bay being the closer - it's only a 10-15 minute walk at most but looks deceptively closer and in the significant heat, it can be a surprisingly gruelling walk too. Taxis are cheap in the city, but the major highway and one-way flow means that a taxi has to make a bit of a loop to connect between the metro and the hotel. Pretty easy connection from the airport - but a taxi is a cheap and hassle free alternative. There's not much going on directly around the hotel and you would do better to be near the Dubai Mall to closer to the main attractions and easier transport. Rooms and hotel facilities are good. Despite the hotel's age (it was one amongst the first hotels to open in the Dubai hotel boom), rooms and facilities are very good - it feels like your standard 4* Hilton/Starwood-esque hotel. Service is great - like most of Dubai, it's service workforce are largely of Indian origin and treat you great - I just hope they're well treated too. A really great deal for just £50 from Lastminute.com. If you want to experience a real Dubai luxury experience or want to be close to the action, this is not the hotel for you. If you're a moderate budget traveller who still wants a bit of niceness and can handle a bit of walking, this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Feels old but is comfy”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTourister59
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute choice for the Eid holdays. I only had 3 days notice that I could go so I was having little luck at my standard haunts. This one came at a reasonable rate and where I wanted to be so I booked it. It is one of the older hotels in Dubai but is well kept considering. the staff was attentive enough. The Asian staff were great but the Russians had a crappy attitude so I avoided them. The doormen were the best part. They were very helpful with directions, taxis, etc. There is a tour desk but I was deeply unsatisfied with their service. They are not part of the hotel though, they just occupy space. The Red Lion pub is in the hotel and it is the oldest English Pub in Dubai. I had most of my meals there and the pub grub was good. Not great but good enough. The beer selection left a bit to be desired but was enough. There is a small shop area with a mini mart, men's and women's hair slaon, car rental agency, and a movie thetare right next door. It had just about everything you need for a busy traveller like me. I may stay there again if I get a good price. If not then it is back to the 5 star digs in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel sentral located”
Reviews.Author: Bjoern M B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel many times the last years. Always nice and polite staff. Service friendly at any time. Easy to go to the beach. Take the the hotel bus to Jumeira Beach Park (5 Dihram entrance fee). Lively in the evenings in Red Lion, british pub, outside and inside. Relaxced atmotphere with your pint (or whatever) and good food. Our other favourites, the italian restaurant, Don Corleone and pool bar. Short ride in hotel bus or taxi to Dubai Mall and the tower Burj Kalifa. Coming back in the beginning of October 2011 to wisit family. Last stay in the beginning of August 2011. So for for us so far: The one and only Metropolitan Hotel, Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: InjiM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of December as had a last minute work trip and the hotel I usually stay at was booked up. I would have to say that it was a nice hotel but nothing more. It looks rather dated but the service was great and the rooms were spacious, I found the garden a little bland and there was no outdoor pool. I ate in the fish bazaar in the hotel one night and have to say had some of the best Thai fish I have ever had! Very impressed by the food and buffet breakfast too. I would not recommend it for business travelers as there was noisy families and the walls were rather thin. They also had a couple of night clubs in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Free Shopping Mall Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Startrekker13
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel, our room was spacious and very well appointed with nice furnishings. Cleanliness and security was of a high priority. The bed was a kingsize and very comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and gave advise on attractions. They have a doorman who was very attentive in getting taxis and advice on shuttles. They have a free Shuttle which go every 30mins to The Dubai Mall and the Mall of Emirates which was my favourite. From the Dubai Mall you will be able to access the The Burj Kaliffa tower. Our breakfast was included and it was a buffett style very much english and american quisine. We also used the coffee shop for our evening meal and found the menu had a good selection and the meals where generous and good.This hotel had its own gym or fitness centre ,tho we didnt use we went and had a look and it was impressive. We would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a family weekend”
Reviews.Author: DaniSan
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we stay at the Metropolitan because they organize an international softball tournament every year during March/April. I must admit that this time it was so much better, the hotel is old but the rooms are nice and clean, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, we even booked one of their front desk ladies to babysit our toddler for a few hours. The location is also great, only 5 minutes drive from Dubai Mall. Overall a good place to stay only if you can find a good rate, Dubai can be very expensive and this hotel is not the exception.

Reviews.Title: “My home while in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Oldstyle_53
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dubai for work about 25 weeks a year. In the last 5 months I have been staying at the Metropolitan. By far, the friendliest staff I have ever met. Older hotel, not a resort, but great value for the price. The pool and gym in the residences next door are very nice compared to similar hotels. The outdoor eating area is being renovated, but still a nice place for dinner. Convenient to the Metro, taxis always at the front door. Don't waste your time on the shuttle to MOE, take a taxi. Nice, quick shuttle to the beach. Good breakfast, nice variety of restaurants, again GREAT staff make it a good place for an extended stay or return visit. There are "business girls" around after 10:00 pm, but that's the case with most hotels in Dubai. Just ignore them, they go away. Lot's of expats in the residence next door.

Reviews.Title: “An old world charm, hotel for a quiet getaway.”
Reviews.Author: arkay74
Reviews.Content: The Metropolitan is an excellent choice for people who do not have deadlines to meet. The staff were very helpful when it came to organising activities for the day. Although most hotels have their own activity desks, the staff can be persuaded to help with alternative sight seeing arrangements to suit your budget. The staff in the restaurant are equally pleasant and helpful and the breakfast fare, in the form of a buffet, was adequate. There were a few shuttles taking patrons to different malls at dfferent times at no cost. Shuttles were also available to take patrons to the sister hotels of the group. Our only disappointment was the situation of the new Metro at the Business Bay station which is a twenty minute walk from the hotel, which can be challenging in the heat. The hotel is in eye shot of the Burj Khalifa but not much shopping in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Gcinz
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the interior of the hotel, the exterior need a bit of refurbishment to be catchy, inside however, the foyer, corridors and rooms it looks neat and precise. it is a very good hotel near major attractions and it's easy to understand dubai if you are staying there. The service was very good! there is abundance of entertainment from various restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by the professional photographs.”
Reviews.Author: meganegirl1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after nights of searching for a good location, that was not too expensive. I was seriously dissapointed by the location (directly opposite a very busy motorway). We had to get taxis everytime we wanted to leave the hotel (which was everyday and night). The hotel actually shares its pool with another hotel and is in need of some serious work! It looks nothing like the lovely pool photos that the hotel shows. And do not use the tour desk (sun city) located in the lobby to book any tours. You have been warned! All in all, the hotel was reasonably priced, however i would have paid more to stay in a better hotel if i knew what it was really going to be like.

Reviews.Title: “Big NO for family holiday”
Reviews.Author: MP101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropolitan Hotel with family for a holiday, 10 nights. Not recommended for family, night time hotel ground is swamp with ladies looking Business. Complain to management regarding this, said they knew about this, but did nothing the removed them. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “good hotel on a good metro line”
Reviews.Author: zizzag
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a good position, good to use the metro, quite central 4 all of dubai's attractions, the hotel is one of the oldest ones in the city but clean and comfortable the staff were all of a proffesional standard and very helpful with an excellent understanding of english. we used this hotel rather than one of the higher priced hotels in the city and were very pleased we had. i would recomend this hotel to any one on a budget, we managed to have a 9 night stay here 4 far less than a 4 night stay at a much higher priced one. good value all round.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be tempted with the cheap price and fancy pictures.”
Reviews.Author: BasilorCybil
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Hotel is not worthy of its star rating, felt much like a 2 or 3 star hotel. It is in desperate need of renovation to keep it to a standard that one expects from Dubai hotels. Okay it is a case of you get what you pay for, but there were other choices of hotels in the budget and wished I had gone for these. Breakfast was only okay, nothing to shout about. Room was clean but looked dated and tired. Staff were always in their own world and didn't really seem too bothered when talking to them - (nothing to do with language or understanding what you said either). Worst of all, went for a drink in the evening at the hotel bar located in the gardens after a long day walking around shopping malls, and the bar was basically full of women offering services that are not appropriate in a family hotel, -in other words a "knocking shop", to compound the problem, the staff at the hotel knew about it, and make no attempt at stopping it. Avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: DocKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed with colleagues at this hotel in March and was unimpressed. The hotel itself is fine but it is located next to a highway and the hotel bar at night is frequented by 'ladies of the night' that make socialising in the bar uncomfortable. We checked out early and headed to the Bur Deira area of Dubai and checked into the Arabian Courtyard. Much more pleasant neighbourhood and relaxed and comfortable hotel. Metropolitan Hotel Dubai is probably best suited to business travellers who are staying for one or two nights and want to be in the middle of Bur Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food, & service...felt like I was a million miles away!”
Reviews.Author: lerickson78
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly pleased with our choice of hotel in Dubai. I had not been to this sprawling metropolis in almost 5 years and it's become even more of a zoo. The Metropolitan Hotel was an oasis in the midst of controlled chaos. The chinese restaurant had good service, ambience, and excellent food. The italian restaurant was okay, I'd recommend the pasta over the pizza. The English pub was almost authentic and the garden was a great hangout spot. The pool facilities were nice and clean with a swim-up bar if you wanted to partake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and plenty to do”
Reviews.Author: Czech_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a business trip in January and generally enjoyed the experience. Hotel is very well located for the Mall and sightseeing, although quite a way from the beach itself, rooms arre average size, although nothing special and internet is expensive. Plenty of restaurants to choose from and nice bars outside to sit and watch the sports (and the girls !). Had no problems getting regular taxis right outside the hotel, even very early in the morning - and only 20 AED to the airport. Service was generally good, few issues with key card and minibar charges but all quickly resolved.... and the Rattlesnake bar is an experience in itself !!! Overall I think an above average 4 star and worth a look if you can get a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Also felt a bit ripped off”
Reviews.Author: rosieandjan
Reviews.Content: Very much like the previous reviewer I also felt badly treated by this hotel. Staff were very average, room very average and food in restaurant very nice. However the breakfast was appauling, food dried up and tired and unappetising. The service area looked dirty with a tired look. We tried to cancel breakfast the next morning but the hotel refused, so we paid for a meal we did not have. Also were shown to a 'taxi' by the porter, after a small stop off we were charged 100 dirams. I complained to hotel but the usual excuses Im afraid so will take this one off the list for next time

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, big NO NO.”
Reviews.Author: thailove
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night . check in was slow and took me 15 minutes. The rooms are pretty small and bathroom is very small. Restaurant is way over priced for a 4star hotel. nothing really good about this hotel everything is slow and staff are just average. And when i checked out and trying to go to the airport. I asked for a cab. but a lexus pulled up infront me and i told the guy agian i need a cab not a lexus. And this is what he said"Sir this is cab". i had a flight to catch and i didnt want to argue with the guy. they charged me 40AED. which is about 2 times as much as regular cab. 20AED maybe not that much of money for lot a people. but the thing is not about the money, is how the hotel treats its customers. this basically shows how bad this hotel really is. will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a relaxing stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Simoncik
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a great location for a relaxing time off: - nice recreation facilities (swimming pool & fitness center) - a wide choice of restaurants (italian, indian, chinese, fish, grill, pub) - easy access to shopping malls (Dubai Mall & Mall of the Emirates) with free shuttle services - quality pick-up service from airport ... and on the day of my birthday, they surprised me with a delicious chocolate cake in our room

Reviews.Title: “Did not provide requested rooms.”
Reviews.Author: captain_yossarian
Reviews.Content: The location was really good. very close to the burj khalifa skyscraper and dubai mall, which are next to each other. Room was modern, comfortable, and clean, except for a slight musty smell that's typical of those cheezy motels. bed was firm and comfortable, albeit small. Only complaint is we asked for adjoining rooms with double beds, and this request was even shown on our confirmation letter. but when we arrived, no adjoining rooms, and no double beds, just small single beds. we complained but they just said, "sorry." at least our rooms were on the same floor. I guess unless you are regular guests at their hotel, which i am not, they will not take the time accommodate your needs. The check in experience is important, as it sets the tone for your entire stay at a hotel, and our check in was disappointing. I would still recommend this hotel to a friend, but only marginally, and with reservations. suggest if you have any special requests that you call them directly and confirm a few days prior to arrival.

Reviews.Title: “I had wonderfull stay”
Reviews.Author: roneey
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my stay at metropolitan hotel shaikh zayed raod,resturants were amazing all staff helpfull and friendly specially front office staff Mr. farooq he was amazing, he helped me every day to arrange my day plan where i could enjoy every day.The best thing hotel was close to tallest bulding and shopping mall and I also liked complimenty shuttle service for shopping mall, over all i enjoyed my stay and would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “they treated me as a queen!”
Reviews.Author: Ivanna999
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room that is really good, I had everything I need. I was surprised how the staff was friendly. They are the most kindness people I ever met! I came in with a lot of luggage and with out asking they help me carry it to my room. They treated me as a queen! I am quite satisfied and would definitely recommend this hotel to other people!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable friendly hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Carimakan77
Reviews.Content: There are mixed reviews on this hotel and this review is based on the experience of my wife and myself during our 10-night stay from 1st.-11th.December, 2010. We were made most welcome on our arrival and the friendliness of all staff prevailed for the duration of our stay. The room was clean, comfortable and well-maintained by the housekeeping staff. We stayed on a bed & breakfast basis and the breakfast was buffet style with a cooking station for eggs to order. There are several themed restaurants within the hotel although we did not use any of them. The grounds of the hotel are quite extensive and incorporate a large swimming pool which is accessed through an outbuilding and the hotel also boasts the oldest pub in Dubai which has a large outdoor seating area for drinks and food. There was never any problem with sun loungers at the pool. A free shuttle bus operates from the hotel to the Dubai Mall and also the Mall of the Emirates and the times are posted in the hotel lobby. These shuttle buses are not operated by the hotel but we found the schedule was adhered to very well. The hotel is close to the Dubai Mall and the shuttle bus only takes a few minutes to get there however if you catch the shuttle bus back to the hotel it will take over an hour to return as it serves numerous hotels and the Metropolitan is the last on the list. The plus side is that this will give you a free bus tour of Dubai right out to Jumeirah Beach Hotel and out onto the Palm to the Atlantis Hotel. Taxis are abundant in Dubai at any time of the day or night and operate on the meter without question. They are excellent value and are the best way of getting around the city which is not really designed for walking any distance. Similarly, when arriving at Dubai Airport there is no need to pre-arrange a transfer to any of the hotels. A taxi-marshall will direct you to your taxi from a well-disciplined fast-moving queue. There are three other hotels in Dubai which incorporate the word Metropolitan and you must specify to the driver that it is the Metropolitan in Sheikh Zayed Road. There is no shortage of money-changing facilities in any of the Malls. If you intend to go up the Burj Khalifa tower, this is accessed from the lower ground floor of the Dubai Mall. The best plan is to purchase a timed ticket for a day or two in advance and this will cost you 100 Dirhams. If you go along thinking you will just be able to go up the tower then you will be disappointed as it is mostly sold out for that day. In the unlikely event that there was immediate availability it would cost you 400 Dirhams. We booked two tours locally during our stay viz. A Dhow Dinner Cruise and a Desert Safari both of which we enjoyed. These tours cost 140 Dirhams (£24.39) and 170 Dirhams (£29.62) respectively. This was per person and included pick-up and drop-off from your hotel. If we had pre-booked these tours from our travel agent in UK they would have been £49 per person - virtually double the price. If returning to Dubai we would not have any hesitation in making a return visit to the Metropolitan Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unfriendly hotel staff and manager”
Reviews.Author: Tipsfortrios
Reviews.Content: Extremely arrogant, unfriendly and snooty manager and staff, stay was unpleasant as they were very unreasonable and did not keep to their word with regard to the room rates discussed. No free Internet in the hotel and chargable Internet at a ridiculous rate. Overall it was their attitude that made it so unpleasant! DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “"FRUAD!"Do not return my emails, in regards of my $2000 deposit for visa!!!"”
Reviews.Author: MehreenUswah
Reviews.Content: My husband needed a visa for our honemoon trip and they asked for various deposits. It has been over 4 month and we are trying to contact them. They have not returned any of our emails or phonecalls. I cannot believe a company of this magnitude could show this type of service. We are in the process of gettng a lawyer since we have no other option. They have $2000 dollars of our money!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: acuf
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable place to stay with many restuarants and a pub with a genuine British feel to it. The rooms are comfortable and convenient and it is close to the industrial area of Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “A nice break”
Reviews.Author: KandA40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just over a week and used it as a base while we went to the F1 Grand Prix in Abu Dhabi. The place was clean and the staff fairly pleasant. We asked for minibar to be emptied (which was done before we got to the room!) so we could use the fridge for milk etc. (they provide evaporated milk to go in your tea in the room so we needed to buy fresh)We were half-board and mostly ate at the Al Saffa coffee shop. The food in there was excellent with a good choice of Indian, Chinese, Thai, Arabic and continental meals on the set menu. You could choose either lunch or dinner. We often opted for lunch as it was a better choice and a nice sized portion (dinner portions were huge!) This menu suited us but we realise it would be no good for people who don't care for spicy food. We used the sky bar some evenings where the drinks were really expensive. We steered clear of the Rattlesnake having read the reviews and were quite amused to see the sheer amount of prostitutes going in there! Just through the back of the hotel is the Pyramids cafe which is not part of the hotel and is used by the locals. There was no alcohol served here but the snacks and freshly sqeezed fruit juices were really good and realisticaly priced. You can also smoke Shisha here for a lot less than at the hotel. The hotel is well situated for Dubai Mall and The Mall of the Emirates. The hotel runs a free bus but taxis are cheap and its just a few minutes walk to the Business Bay metro Station. On the whole we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hookers Galore”
Reviews.Author: PlymouthTrish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, a bit dated , the room was small but adequate. The stories about the hookers are ABSOLUTELY true. We spoke to ex-pats there who worked in Dubai and were there just to drink, and were told The Rattle Snake is the oldest and most established hooker pick up joint in Dubai. The prostitution is everywhere in Dubai , but i think some are just a bit more discreet than others. Apparently the hotel charges the girls to come in, probably why they turn a blind eye, but the girls who dont want to pay. hide behind the trees outside the front.... they were everywhere. The hotel can be a bit noisy too, with the clubs turning out at 3am, and the music before hand. I personally didnt find it a problem but my cousin was ripping her hair out. Admittedly the hotel did get the music turned down after her second call to reception. The indian restaurant was OK, but the hotel breakfast was not good, although plenty of choice, but I have had much nicer food elsewhere. Alcohol everywhere is expensive, expect to pay between £30-£40 for a bottle of wine costing a few pounds at home . egJacobs Creek. This is the same everywhere in Dubai. Average pint about £7 and spirits the same. Cockails on average £10 . Its dear to eat out too. Trips - we went to the Burj Khalifa - excellent , a must do in Dubai. We also got a boat down the creek to the Gold souk, this was fabulous. We booked High tea at the Burj Al Arab, this was another must do, very expensive but wouldnt have misssed it. However I felt the place was really over-rated and tacky! The interior designer needs shooting!. We booked the desert safari BBQ thru the hotel with SunCity tours. This was a complete rip off. 2 hours in a bus, 10 minutes dune bashing which was fun, but the driver never spoke to us. Then we were dropped at the bedhuin village with about 1000 others who were all looking as bemused as us. They advertise the trip as including a camel ride. There were only 3 camels for all those people and they walked in a tiny circle and that was it! The food was awaful and you queued ages to get it. like the school dinner queue. There was loads of sitting about with nothing happening, then a brief act by a dancer and a fire act. Neither of which you could see because the people at the front stood up and refused to sit down. It was a totaly wasted evening. Lots of people were complaining, the next day after continuing our complaint we finally got half refunded. I had heard the trip was good, maybe with a different company it is. The manager of Sun City tried to pacify us with a bottle of Jacobs Creek between 7 and then tried to charge us for it the next day when we still complained. Dubai is a fascinating city, I am so glad i have seen it. However, give me the Caribbean every time. Great for shopping and lots to see, but once was enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Russ_and_hayley
Reviews.Content: staff were amazingly helpful and wouldn't hesitate to bend over backwards to help with anything, taxi's are readily available, very clean and tidy and beautifully presented, rooms are fully equipped with anything and everything that you can need. honestly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in, as a young couple we thought we may feel a little neglected but found it the complete opposite! defiantly would love to stay here again. would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. other reviews advised on prostitutes etc, we never saw any of this and didn't think it happened. hotel is in a brilliant position with free shuttles to the beach and malls, Dubai mall is only 5mins away and cost about £4 in a taxi if you didn't want to wait for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and well positioned for the Buiness District/Malls.”
Reviews.Author: mikedunstall
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Dubai Metropolitan three times, following a recommendation from one of our clients, in the last two years, and profess it meets my needs. The position on the Sheik Zayed Road is good for the business district, and shopping Malls: Emirates and Dubai. Though only a 4-Star these days it is well appointed and the staff are most helpful/courteous. A Pick-up from/to airport is available. All rooms are very comfortable, with some nice touches, and well fitted. The Hotel has the infamous Red Lion Sports bar for dad and his football, and an outside area. Also there are 5 restaurants, my favourite being the Shahjahan, the indian food plentiful and authentic and first rate, and the manager attends to all the customers; that said,the Summer Garden and Thai Fish Bar are also very good. The swimming pool is okay, and is part of the apartment site Health club, but again well tended by staff. Overall, not necessarily a young family hotel, but for teenagers no problem, and the hotel owners have there own Cinema next door. On the last day this time we went of a Dune Safari etc arranged by the hotel's own travel centre, absolutely wonderful and not to be missed, great for all the family. So yes maybe one of the oldest hotels in Dubai and still low-level in building type, not exciting from the outside but once the door opens you are at home..., so I will stay again without question, why pay more?

Reviews.Title: “hotel without honour”
Reviews.Author: slingerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights,as part of our 35th wedding anniversary. We arrived at 06.15 in the morning after flying overnight form Maritius. We were informed we could not have a room until 14.00, but we could upgrade to an executive room for 300 dirams a night as we were so tired we took the room. We were told that the executive lounge and the minibar in the room was included in the rate. Upon checking out I was informed that the mini bar had to be paid for, I disputed this and explained that we were told it was in with the rate, the staff more or less called me a liar and as we had to go to the airport had no choice but to pay. The reason this hotel is not suitable for families is that they condone shall we say ladies of the night being in the hotel with there clients it is not a pleasant site. They tend to sit in the Oak room and are mainly Phillipino young ladies. The staff simply turn a blind eye so please if you go with children please be very aware. Under no circumstances would I recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “4 * not on this earth , poor 3*”
Reviews.Author: JonathanPaul66
Reviews.Content: stayed at the metropolitan for a brief 2 night stay on the way to Mauritius. the location of the hotel is great for whizzing into the City for shopping and sight seeing. taxis are dirt cheap and its about £3/4 pounds to the dubai mall and Burj Khalifa tower, takes about 5 mins by taxi, this is not a pedestrian friendly city buts that is where the good points end. it is an old hotel by dubai standards, 30 years, and it shows and feels it. we had a superior room. nothing superior about it. clean tidy, yes, but old and dated in style, as the whole hotel is the hotel service was fine, breakfast was good, cant comment on the other restuarants as never used them. had 2 meals (snack type) in the sports bar, which where good, lots of xpats whatching the football, like being home ! the bar in the garden is nice, plus its still boiling hot at midnight, so is nice to have a cold beer after a hard day sight seeing. adjacent to the garden bar, is the rattlesnake bar/club........hm, yes. the hotel as a garden entrance , directly to the rattlesnake club, you may read some good reviews from business travellers about this hotel , thats because the rattlesnake club is a knocking shop ! if you want a knocking shop........you,ve landed ! to be honest , its out of the way , you dont get bothered, and comings and goings start at midnight,, by which time i was ready for bed........with the wife ! long and short, great location for sight seeing, but if you are taking the wife or want to impress, dont bother, unless you get a great deal and its only as a base for a short stay. there are a lot of lovely brand new hotels in this city for a few ££s more if you shop around wisely

Reviews.Title: “Great Place convenient friendly and a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: chris_x_smith
Reviews.Content: Thank you for a great weekend. Comfortable friendly and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star ????”
Reviews.Author: Colly67
Reviews.Content: Having read a few mixed reviews on this hotel, but with some of the more recent ones being positive decided to give this hotel a go for the 6 day break i was taking, in preference to my usual choices of either Majestic, Towers Rotana, or Jumerira Rotana... what a mistake !!! (1) Things started to go wrong right from check-in, handed my credit card over for the usual blocking of money to cover things charged to the room, however little did i know they did nothing with the card, hence when later that evening i came to charge a few beers to the rooms, was told they could only accept cash from me !!, complained at reception and was told i had not told them when checking-in i wanted this service... excuse me thought this was standard practice in all hotels ?? (2) Had requested non-smoking room, which i did get, however rooms on each floor have both smoking and non-smoking, so you can still smell the smoke even in non-smoking rooms. (3) All the other hotels i have stayed in in Dubai have always provided complimentary bottled water each day... not this hotel, was told water was only complimentary on check-in, and if i wanted more i would have to buy from room service or purchase from shop in the arcade, which i did for Dh2 each, what false economy from the hotel, times must be bad if they cannot afford Dh2 per day ! 4) Inside the room the furniture was pretty warn and decoration dated, stuck in 90's timewarp. Also there was only one double socket in the room, so you had to make a choice of 2 from either the TV, Kettle, phone charger, or laptop. And on this theme there is no way you could use your laptop plugged into socket and also plugged into the internet connection, they were just too far away. 5) Then there was breakfast... was told it was DH90 per day when checking in (which is not good value), however being hungry first couple of mornings decided to take it and signed for Dh90. On last day decided again to take but was only charged Dh70, and when questioned why the difference was advised there was a different price depending on what you had, but i had had the same the 2 previous times, however told it was my fault for signing for that price. Later that day then found out if you have the same breakfast in the coffee shop it only costs Dh45 !!! Well i suppose for bargain price £70 per night through TravelRepublic, i got what i paid for, however there is no way anyone should spend the standard price of circa £120 per night, much better hotels around for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Great Night Club”
Reviews.Author: vijaygupta
Reviews.Content: I went to dubai for one night for business and booked this hotel and Find this hotel very very good , though the hotel was built very long time but still it is very very well mantianed and Rattel Snake Night Club is best part ..... and food is good, specialy indian food. I recommend this hotel very much

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Suillean
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for one night. I found the hotel staff to be be very helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious and the hotel was quiet. We ate twice at the Al Saffa restaurant and thought that both the breakfast and dinner buffets offered a vast array of delicious and tempting foods. I found the location to be convenient and it was easy to catch a bus to the local shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: rhubarb2uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on our way to the Maldives for our honeymoon in September 2010. We arrived very early morning and although our room was not supposed to be ready till 2pm they managed to get us in at 9am which we were very grateful for. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, the rooms were large and comfortable too. The mall shuttle buses run to the Dubai mall & the mall of the emirates free of charge and if any of these were ever full the hotel staff would personally drive you there in the hotels car which was fantastic service. Really enjoyed our stay here and although not as extravagant as many Dubai hotels we thought it was a perfect base to explore Dubai. Beware of the price of beer though it was 74 Dirhams for 2 pints!! and although they offer a shuttle bus to their sister hotel it will still cost you about £15 each for entry and the Habtoor is not that special.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Javerage
Reviews.Content: Arrived late (11pm) after an 8-hour flight from Dublin and it took a while to check in (six rooms for the group) but things improved quickly. Dined in the Chinese restaurant (11.30pm to 1am) and the meal was just sensational! The service very good. The King sized bed was perfect and the room offered good value for money. The only downside was that we were told we had used mini-bar stock upon checking out which was untrue. Getting that sorted was tough (to the value of AED 44) but it was not be enough to stop me staying at Sheikh Zayed Road again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: leoness
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service from the minute we arrived at the airport (although their airport shuttle only runs to Terminal 1 and 3, they waited for me to arrive from Terminal 2 to meet my friend). Mihaela on reception was very helpful when we checked in, and all the staff were very friendly and professional. Our room was excellent (at £10 a night more than a UK city centre Travelodge, it was an absolute bargain!). The beds were exceptionally comfortable and even though our room was on the main road there was no traffic noise, or noise from anywhere else (including the nightclub). If we had to be really picky and make one complaint, it was the lack of power in the hairdryer!! A great choice at breakfast, cooked or continental, cereals, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, cold meats and cheeses. Plenty of restaurants to choose from too and we ended all four nights of our stay in the Red Lion with some very friendly expat locals. The pool and pool bar were lovely, even when it got busy it wasn't overcrowded. The location may seem a little out of the way compared to Bur Dubai, but having driven around Bur Dubai at night and seen where other hotels were located we were very pleased at having chosen the Metropolitan, a short taxi ride gets you anywhere and shuttle buses are provided to the Dubai and Emirates malls, and Jumeirah Beach Park. All in all and excellent stay in a great hotel... no hesitation in recommending it and we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahMcM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel during December of 2009, it was our first holiday together, we had a truely lovely experience. There are numerous restaurants readily available, service and quality of the food was excellent, we were never disappointed. A steak cooked on the outdoor BBQ comes highly recommended!! The Christmas decorations were amazing and changed twiced during our week long stay. The staff were friendly and very helpful, we booked two excursions through the hotel and they were fantastic. The free bus service is useful and whatever time of day or night taxi's are available immediately. We would definately recommend it to family and friends and we are looking forward to visiting again sometime in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Land of nice staff and great bars”
Reviews.Author: Behzadipour
Reviews.Content: The staff is very frindely and nice. It's great for night-life, There are bars and a great disco. The rooms are romantic... Also it's near Dubai mall and there are daily suttles to malls and beach.

Reviews.Title: “We will return !”
Reviews.Author: Oztour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Metropolitan now on 8 occasions (3night stop-overs between Australia & Europe) and this speaks for itself as to how we rate this friendly hotel. We have stayed in more upmarket hotels in Dubai over the years but prefer the atmosphere and service of the Metropolitan. From the welcome at Reception to the so many willing and friendly staff (no matter what area) we feel "at home" and appreciate being a resident & enjoy the relaxing R&R between continents. Restaurants (varied) are all good and menus give lots of choices.. My only reason for not rating the Rooms excellent is, naturally, they are getting a little tired - but still fully serviced and comfortable. Thanks Metropolitan & Staff for another happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable and comfortable stay..5 stars”
Reviews.Author: looolzat
Reviews.Content: nightlife is great with pro staff at the bar and hotel,its safe i cant imagine myself in dubai in other hotel after my 2 stays before in here.clean room,spacious,attentive housekeeping,room service is delicious,free park on site,taxi are available 24/7

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stopover on the way to Europe”
Reviews.Author: aussiebloke3
Reviews.Content: I had an enjoyable stay at the Metropolitan Hotel. The staff were polite and helpful. We enjoyed the selection of food available for breakfast. The room, we stayed in, was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with business atitude with leisure included”
Reviews.Author: manish2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all the required amenities including nos of reastaurants,swimming pool, bar, sports bar,gym,etc.Only the location is little far from city center.It is a good hotel for business with leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Please try this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dubai1111
Reviews.Content: My family and i have been to Dubai 3 times previously and i have to say this hotel is great, not like some of the other reports you may read. My wife, teenage daughter and i stayed for a week at the end of May 2010 and the Hotel did exactly what i asked of them. interconecting rooms were great, both rooms cleaned with new linen & towels daily. The staff were lovely people and only too willing to help or just to be pleasant. The hotel 4x4 was there to meet us on our arrival at DXB and delivered us back to the airport for departure. Stayed B&B and there were no complaints about the food at all. The pool is a great place to chill out with again great staff cool drinks and a good selection of snacks if you fancy. Taxi services are right outside the door and if you don't want to use the Hotel taxi, just tell the consierge they won't fall out with you at all!! All in all a good value for money hotel. No issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: sassyminx_10
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay in this hotel, it's quiet, A/C great, rooms are a good size, very clean throughout, no dripping taps, everything works, excellent service always. Upgraded to executive floor for a small extra and had complimentary internet in our room, full breakfast, afternoon tea sandwiches and cakes, canapes and drinks (3 each) pm, in a lounge with tv just for us..waheed our personal waiter is so polite and professional we were sorry to leave, beds are comfy too and they give you 2 pillows, ground floor pool outside, just perfect....

Reviews.Title: “Would difinately recommend”
Reviews.Author: mcf146
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel was 10 mins from the airport, had excellent facilities including a wonderful pool. It was very clean and the staff excellent. I will definately return and would recommend

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: gwg40
Reviews.Content: The first time I used this hotel and I can only recommend. Staff very friendly and helpfull, good choice of restaurants and good pup, fantastic outside garden. You are in the city but you have very good outside space to enjoy. Very good for sports lovers as all the action sports are on TV, with sreens inside and outside. The place to relax after a heavy buisnes day and you dont have to leave the hotel. Very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MissLS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon. There isn't much to say about it - just average and found the staff (not all but a few) quite ignorant and not really helpfull as well. Food just ok, location ok. Loved Dubai itself and really want to go back though definitely not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Metropolitan Hotel is the best kept secret in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: cctxtravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself travel frequently and found the staff and amenities at this facility to be superior to most. The staff at this hotel will bend over backwards to ensure your stay is memorable.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable and welcoming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NandSManchester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel on 3 separate occasions during February and March whilst transiting via Dubai to other destinations and, although each of our stays was for 1 night only, the level of service and the friendliness and helpful nature of the staff were in no way diminished by that - they were all supurb. Rooms were fine, especially on the 2nd floor. Breakfasts were quite adequate with, we felt, suffient choice. In view of our stays being short, we were able to sample only 2 of the restaurants for dinner (Don Corleone's and the Fish Bazaar) - the former was OK/average, the latter really was excellent (not only the food itself but the assistance we received in composing the meal). This year they're celebrating their 40th year so, as far as we're concerned, here's to their next 40!!

Reviews.Title: “great city break”
Reviews.Author: janesp
Reviews.Content: I have read previous reviews of this hotel, which didn't give a good review, so thought I would give my version. The Metropolitan City Dubai is situated on a service road just off the main road (14 lanes}. You would expect some noise, but it didn't bother me, I just put my earplugs in at bedtime. There is not much surrounding the hotel, but there is a petrol station within walking distance where you can purchase cold drinks, coffee, sandwiches (Subway) and other snacks which I recommend as the hotel bar and coffee shop are very expensive. The staff are very friendly, polite and helpful and always say good morning, hello, etc. the room was a little cramped, but that was because we requested a third bed, but it was clean and we were given a choice of smoking or none smoking. Try not to be tempted by the mini bar as it is very expensive. There was complimentary bottled water and fruit but this was not replaced once you had consumed them. We used the hotel restaurants as there was nothing else close by. Food was good but expensive. You could use taxis,but make sure you use the public ones and not the hotel cars as they are twice the price. We visited the public beach and it was only 10 dirhams in the taxi. The beach is fantastic, you can pay a small fee for beds, towels and parasols and there are a couple of burger bars there which are fairly cheap and water only 2 dirhams a bottle. Entrance to the public beach was 5 dirhams. We used the hotel pool which was great, very clean and they provided towels free of charge for hotel guests and no charge for the sun loungers, which had nice thick mattresses on them. There is also a gym and spa treatments which we didn't use. Some reviews mention the fact that call girls frequent the hotel, There was only one person that we saw in the pub that we had suspisions about, but I didn't see any problems. Over all, we had a great stay, pity everything was so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here, this is effectively a glorified brothel”
Reviews.Author: veiledicequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stopover on the way back from Mauritius in January. We had read the reviews before we went but decided we would go with an open mind and make our own minds up. What a bad mistake we made by picking this hotel!!!! We arrived about 8 am and at the check in desk we saw what appeared to be a prostitute rolling in from the night before. Scantility dressed as she was wearing a skimpy dressed with her bra strap rolling down her shoulder, ruffled hair and her neck covered in bite marks. Whilst waiting for our room to be prepared we went into the breakfast room, where there were a small party of eastern European prostitutes having breakfast. We were shown to our room, which was tatty and musty and in desperate need of upgrading. We complained to our holiday rep, who was far from helpful and would only move us if we agreed to pay $200 more. He left the decision with us and conveniently didnt get back to us as he was on holiday. We put up with this shambles of a hotel for the whole 4 days. We complained to the manager about the prostitute problem and he basically played dumb and tried to bribe us with a rotting fruit basket and and an offer of moving us to another equally repulsive room, which we flatly declined. Do not stay at this hotel, it is locally known and a brass house, and it is openly crawling with prostitutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: jeromeQueensland
Reviews.Content: I have to agree 100% with the previous reviews. This hotel seems to be a haven in bustling Dubai. The location is perfect, within easy reach of everything. Pick up from the airport had been arranged by the hotel and on arrival we got a free City tour. Check-in without any problems by very polite staff. Really comfortable beds in very clean rooms. Good choice of restaurants, the chinese was absolutely delicious, although with a bit erratic service. Italian restaurant served terrible food, but we ate there twice because of the excellent and pleasant service. Breakfast room is a bit too small and at times gets busy and was a bit chaotic. The service here could be improved, some of the waiters did not seem to know what to do. We absolutely enjoyed the friendly female chef at the egg station, who prepared delicious omelettes. Red Lion Pub was too noisy for us to eat there, but nice atmosphere for a relaxing drink. There was a tiny problem with our check-out bill, which was rectified immediately without comment. We would definitely stay in this hotel again on our next Dubai visit.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit, would go again”
Reviews.Author: SeahorseNorthampton
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Dubai and I was not disappointed.The hotel was very comfortable and provided a good range of restaurants from Indian to Italian. The staff were very polite and the doorman advised on cost of taxi to various locations. Guest services were excellent. I would stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find, should be kept a secret so don't tell anyone !!”
Reviews.Author: roro95
Reviews.Content: After booking, then reading the reviews we were expecting to be disapointed, but what a surprise ! I was late trying to book the airport shuttle from the airport, but once coming thru customs I saw a Metropolitan hotel info desk and enquired about transport, after a brief call the lady asked us to wait 15 minutes as a car was on its way ( at 2am ), she even offered us a drink. a beautiful 4x4 picked us up and took us to the hotel, the consierge took our bags and were checked in after 5 minutes. our room was larger than expected with a comfy chair, sofa, large tv and an enormous bed, in fact we were so comfy we slept in thru breakfast ! our first day we took the shuttle bus to the sister hotel to use its beach facilities that were very nice, new towels, plenty of beds, great pool and slide, kids club and I even got to ride a camel on the beach. The resturauants back at our hotel were lively, we ate at The Red Lion pub in the grounds watching a large screen showing football, the food was plentiful and good. All the staff were helpful, and using the shuttles gives you a mini tour of the city each time. A relaxing day around the pool, where there were 3 staff, the swim up pool served cool drinks and a good lunch, again the towels and beds were very good. As others have stated there is a night club in the grounds where a lot of attractive women go, but who am I to say wether they're having a good night out or working and they never seemed to bother anyone, its far worse watching girls outside clubs in England than here ! Our only regret was taking the shuttle to the Outlet Mall, it took an hour to get there and if we had taken the shuttle back we would have missed our plane on our last evening so we took a cab, that cost quite a bit, but that has no reflection on the hotel service that was our missdoing, but still a mini adventure ! The overall appearance is much more grander, professional and superior service than other have shared here, you cannot beat this hotel for the value just a shame that Dubai is expensive !

Reviews.Title: “At first looks old fashioned later you don not notice and enjoy service”
Reviews.Author: pablomadridMadrid
Reviews.Content: Entering the hotel I look sowhat old fashioned, sad and dark (lot of dark brown colours. From there everything was very pleasant and comfortable. All business trip were to this part of town so location was ok. Good choice of restaurants all with excelent food and exceptional pleasant service. My rooms was orientated towards garden and pub activities that caused some sound disturbance in the beginning but later on I joint the pub and club so understood better the noise. Tge ratle snake looks a bit out of place with too many girls looking for company but the live music is good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & Fantastic Hotel - Best Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: cool_vinita
Reviews.Content: I must say i made a very wise/smart decision. This hotel is indeed conveniently located on Sheikh Zayed Road - Dubai's most commercialized district. I had indeed such a brilliant time at hotel. I had never been to a Hotel where the whole staff made such an effort to make our stay so comfortable. Overall the hotel was very clean and tidy. The atmosphere around the pool is amazing. The food was great. I regularly dined at the restaurants within the hotel and i must admit the food was very delicious the restaurants i dined namely Summer Place, Don Corleone & Fish Bazaar. I enjoyed the live entertainment at the American-Western Rattle Snake (Bar and Restaurant) which is open till 3 am. It's a great place to come and unwind. It is a casual venue so jeans and shirts are welcome. Not to forget The Red Lion, which happens to be one of the oldest British pubs in Dubai where Various sporting events can be seen on the big screen TV and the beer garden is a favourite hangout for barbecue lovers like us. It is the best hotel to stay in Dubai. I recommend as a must hotel to stay whether you're a family, friends or group of teenagers in short this hotel suits every age group.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is whole manage”
Reviews.Author: Valdi777
